text:
Attempt to embed this Copyright string into dll file which is build with Ant does not work as expected: 
product.copyright=\u00a9 Copyright 20xx-20xx yyyyyyyyyyyyy \u2122

Binary dump of dll shows that Ant first converts these characters into UTF-8 and then encodes each individual UTF-8 byte into UTF-16 (as required by Windows for contents of VersionInfo resource) 

So following mapping occurs: 
\u00a9 -> 0x00c2 0x00a9
\u2122 -> 0x00e2 0x201e 0x00a2

While I expect to get this (so it is interpreted properly by Windows):
\u00a9 -> 0x00a9
\u2122 -> 0x2122
creator: fahrenheit2539@gmail.com
jkf@apache.org
text:
Could you please provide the (simplified) build file that can be used to reproduce this error?

Is the output file encoding set correctly?

Are you trying to manipulate a binary file using an ant filter?

If yes -> this is not supported you will corrupt the binary file! 
See: http://ant.apache.org/manual/using.html#filters

creator: fahrenheit2539@gmail.com
text:
Actually I looked at the issue closer and it seems like the problem is not in Ant, but rather in ant-contrib's cpp-tasks, these are used to write VersionInfo resource.
So I'm closing the ticket now
